page.title: 05Linseed crops in Newark
page.content: { Linseed}or flax is grown for two purposes, linen from the stem and oil from the seed. In this area it is grown only for the{oil.} This vegetable oil is used for cooking, having the benefit that is rich in polyunsaturates. The benefit to farmers is that it gives the land a rest after the intensive cereal growing common to this area. There is an unusually large crop in Newark, the farmer who grows it being a specialist. He has made it the biggest crop in Notts. and probably in the country. First the seed is sown and then a plant with a distinctive {blue}flower grows. The new seeds form and swell. The plants are sprayed to dessicate the straw. After harvest, the seeds yield 50% oil. A field of linseed looks like a sea of blue.
